title: Calories in 1 Pound Chicken Breast
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 pound chicken breast, including protein, fat, carbs on a per-100g basis, totals, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast, cooked (roasted or grilled), no sauce/oil added; 1 pound â‰ˆ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut, cooking method, seasoning, water content, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 pound cooked, skinless chicken breast provides ~749 kcal and ~141 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g
Breaded and fried (vs. grilled) per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 pound of cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 749 kcal for skinless, boneless, grilled or roasted.

faqs.q: How much protein in 1 pound chicken breast?
Are these calories for raw or cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw would be higher due to water loss during cooking.

faqs.q: What affects calories in chicken breast the most?
faqs.a: Skin inclusion, added oils, breading, or sauces significantly increase calories.

faqs.q: Per 100 g calories in chicken breast?
faqs.a: Roughly 165 kcal, with 31 g protein and 3.6 g fat for skinless cooked.
